byline.contributor: Max Bearak contributed reporting from Chennai and Suthamalli, India.
byline.original: By TOM MASHBERG and MAX BEARAK

abstract: Investigators in India and United States say they have collected large body of evidence that shows Manhattan art dealer Subhash Kapoor is one of most prolific smugglers of art in United States history; primary component of case against Kapoor consists of 2,622 items confiscated from storerooms in New York City, all of it contraband that originated in India, valued at $107.6 million; Kapoor is suspected of orchestrating looting from vulnerable sites in India.
lead_paragraph: Investigators want to prosecute a man they believe to be the most ambitious antiquities smuggler in American history.

headline.main: The Ultimate Temple Raider?: Inside an Antiquities-Smuggling Operation

snippet: Investigators want to prosecute a man they believe to be the most ambitious antiquities smuggler in American history.
